content: in and cut off the yarn flatten out the piece you just made it should look like a boomerang pull and shape it if necessary find the center 4 stitches and using the tail you left when you finished off the body sew the tail fin to the body weave in the end and bind off page 6 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together this is the head and body before i finished off the back end of the body it looks a lot like a missile at this point and very little like a shark this is how i crocheted the tail area shut crochet through both layers this is the mouth and underbelly you can see how the mouth part curls up like lips because you worked in the back loops in row 3 page 7 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com here i am centering the piece making sure it s in the proper place to look like a mouth the tongue has been sewn in place in this shot here is sharky with his underbelly tail fin and his dorsal fin in place i think i got his tail fin on upside down so be sure to check before you sew here you can see the placement of the side fins and you can see where i embroidered his eyes i like to divide a 4 ply strand of yarn into 2 strands and use that for making eyes and such here i just made an x over one single_crochet stitch at the side of his face and made it a square page 8 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com finished product page 9 of 9 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
